The "Bot Builder" station involves blue robot #1.

In this station, students learn about how the robots are constructed. We talk about wires, motors, controllers, and phones. The station has a robot wired to a tablet, and students hold the tablet and press buttons to control the robot.

The "Remote Control" station involves blue robot #2.

In this station, students are introduced to the idea of wireless control and cameras. The station has a robot with a built-in tablet, and a phone as the controller. Students use the phone to move the robot. They can also have the robot take pictures.

The "Balloon Chase" station involves the red robot.

In this station, students are introduced to the idea of colors and control. The station has a robot with a built-in phone, and a phone as the controller. The controller enables and disables the robot's motors. The robot has two activities: one for training the robot on a color, and one for letting the robot chase a balloon of that color.
